page.title: 07SWANGLES FARM.
page.content: We visited some of the farms in the Rib valley,to interview the farmers. {SWANGLES FARM}is no longer a working farm. Many of the buildings date from 1901,when there was a dairy here. Many of the locals can still remember going to this dairy to buy their milk straight from the cow. These buildings were farm cottages and several of the local people were born in them. The old barns alongside the cottages are being renovated. They were built in 1730 and a condition for the planning permission,is that the new building must be constructed using the original timbers. The fields around the farm have changed in recent years,because many hedges have been removed and ditches have been filled in to enlarge them. The old fields had names such as {"Gypsyfield","Peartree field"}and {"Nine acre field".}
